laboratory_examinations.findings: The pancreas has a peripherally calcified 3.5 x 4.0 cm centrally heterogeneously attenuating mass at the junction of the pancreatic body and tail, associated with overall pancreatic atrophy. The appendix is dilated and fluid-filled measuring up to 1.4 cm. There's extensive stranding within the mesenteric fat of the right lower quadrant, and edema and thickening at the base of the cecum.
